basics.name: Cheng-You Ho (何承祐)
basics.summary: A high school senior passionate about STEM and the universe, having won an international Olympiad, received multiple awards at international science fairs, and published STEM research papers.

awards.title: Silver Medal, 19th International Junior Science Olympiad (IJSO)
awards.summary: Globally ranked 26th. Selected as 1 of 6 national representatives at national selection camp. Self-studied high school physics, biology, and chemistry.

awards.title: Global Finalist, Asia Region Champion, Breakthrough Junior Challege 2023
awards.summary: 2-minute physics video 'The Missing Neutrino' selected as a Global Top 15 Finalist. Popular Vote champion in the Asia Region.

awards.title: 3rd Prize, 2024 Taiwan International Science Fair (TISF)
awards.summary: Project 'Analyzing the Membership Ratio of RR Lyrae Stars in Globular Clusters' awarded 3rd prize in Physics and Astronomy, selected as national representative for MOSTRATEC.

awards.title: 2-time Personal Award, Taiwan Young Physicists' Tournament
awards.awarder: Far Eastern F. Z. Hsu Foundation
awards.summary: Chosen into IYPT (International Young Physicists' Tournament) selection camp for 2 consecutive years. Investigated open-ended physics phenomena as team leader.

awards.title: Nationally Ranked 10th, Taiwan Physics Olympiad
awards.summary: Shortlisted for APhO team. Self-studied undergrad physics. Organized student-led national physics contest.

awards.title: Harvard Book Prize
awards.awarder: Harvard Club of the Republic of China
awards.summary: 'awarded annually to an outstanding high school student in the junior year who demonstrates academic excellence and outstanding character, combined with achievement in extracurricular activities'.

awards.title: 2nd Prize, 2024 MOSTRATEC International Science and Technology Fair
awards.summary: Project 'Star Cluster Evolution — Revealed by Gaia' awarded 2nd prize in Earth and Planetary Sciences and Mathematics and Physics.

projects.name: Delta Knowledge
projects.summary: Leads team of 4, dedicated to science content for 3+ years.

publications.name: Force Model and Experimental Analysis of a Simple Straw Pump
publications.summary: A low-cost centrifugal pump made by folding a straw into a triangle, immersing it into water and spinning it serves both as a DIY demonstration and as a pragmatic water sprinkler. A point-mass model is examined to describe the dynamics of water droplets, followed by correcting it with fluid dynamics. This research reveals insights into the design of fire sprinklers. (click URL for more)

publications.name: Analyzing the Membership Ratio of RR Lyrae Variables in Globular Clusters with Gaia Data
publications.summary: (In press.) In this research, membership ratios of RR Lyrae (RRL) stars in 20 globular clusters are calculated, and their correlation with cluster properties is highlighted. It is concluded that three factors play an essential role in deciding the ratio of RRL variables to the number of stars in the home cluster, which are the cluster age, cluster radius, and metallicity, listed in order of descending impact. It is hypothesized that the formation of RRL stars is correlated with tidal forces and properties of the home galaxy.

volunteer.organization: Chiayi Chang Gung (長庚) Memorial Hospital

volunteer.summary: Mentored students in STEM & English for 2 semesters. Guided freshmans on school projects & adjusting to school life.
